ResourceHeader.Description: The Camden Ionosonde station near Sydney, NSW, Australia, has Ionosondes since November 1980. They are IPS 4C between 06/1997 and 04/2003, IPS 4D between 02/1999 and 12/2004, IPS 5C between 04/1991 and 10/1999, CADI between 07/1997 and 11/2014, IPS 5D since October 1995. Ionosonde information before 1991 is not avaiable. The 5D vertical sounding ionosondes normally sweep in frequency from about 1 to 21.5 MHz. Frequency step resolution for the 5D is 5kHz, with up to 4095 steps available. The step interval is variable, becoming more coarse at higher frequencies as ionograms are generally displayed on a logarithmic scale. See details at http://www.sws.bom.gov.au/World_Data_Centre/2/1/13
